Kevin Ho The union of the interests of Macao professionals, led by Iau Teng Pio, a subdirector of the Faculty of Law of the University of Macao, defends the struggle for the “training of the diversification of the economy in accordance with professional strength” and “the articulation of the rules of Macau and Hengqin”. To this end, it suggests the creation of an “experimental zone of application” of these same norms, exploring “a direct and transfronical execution mechanism of arbitration”. Following is the desire to “strengthen international competitiveness of law”, encouraging “exceptional talents to study in the interior of China”. A face for education Ho Ion Sang, a face that we got used to in direct suffrage, competes again for the indirect suffrage alone, representing the education sector, with the Association of Promotion of Social Service and Education. The candidate calls for the “implementation of mental health support measures” as well as “improving the overall quality of Macao medical services and effectiveness in care”. Ho Ion Sang promises to fight for measures that look “the impact of low birth in the education system” and more “support for inclusive education and special education schools”. The businesswoman Angela Leong joins the first time to MA Chi Seng to compete for the Cultural and Sports Union of Sol Nascente, in defense of culture and sport. One of the ideas is “asking the government to guide the use of the [dealers '[dealers' game to support local cultural and sports activities”. In the “Joint Commission of the Associations of Employees”, led by Deputy Lam Lon Wai, it is defended the improvement of infrastructure, the “reduction of business costs and the facilitation of trade and investment”. The promotion of the “sharing the benefits of economic development with employees” is asked, stabilizing a “salary growth mechanism”. In the union of workers' associations, led by Leong Pou U and Choi Kam Fu, it is suggested “improving the protection of work and workers”, as well as “the protection of the basic rights of workers, improving infrastructure of child support”. The “dynamic adjustment of the minimum wage to ensure basic life needs” is also advocated.

item.title: Visit | Montenegro in Macau on September 10
item.description: The Prime Minister of Portugal, Luís Montenegro, will be in Macao next Wednesday, September 10, where he will have a meeting with the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, and a time at the Portuguese School of Macau. The information was revealed on Thursday by the Jornal Tribuna de Macao, which cites as a source the official's office. The passage through Montenegro arises in the context of a trip to Asia, with stops in the interior of China, and in Macao, following a view to Japan. In the Portuguese Prime Minister's program during the passage through Macau, a reception to the community is still planned, although the publication has not disclosed details about this part. Inside, according to Macau News Agency, Montenegro's visit includes the passage only for Beijing, unlike in the last view of a first-prime from Portugal to China in 2016. That year, António Costa, currently president of the European Council, began to visit Beijing, went to Shanghai and only later in Macau. Montenegro's visit to Macau had been revealed by Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of Portugal, in June, at a time when he confirmed that he was no longer going to visit the masters until the end of his term. The presence of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa in Macau was scheduled for the celebrations of June 10. The view of Luís Montenegro Macau can also help explain the recent cancellation of Sam Hou Fai's travel to Portugal and Spain, which was scheduled for the dates from 16 to 20 September.

item.title: Sam Hou Fai calls for support to Beijing to develop new park

item.title: Legal Training | Kou Peng Kuan renovates and leaves leadership
item.description: Kou Peng Kuan left the position of director of the Legal and Judicial Training Center (CFJJ) on September 1 for being renovated. Although he belonged to the boards of the Directorate of Administration and Public Finance Services (SAFP), where he assumed the position of Director for several years, Kou was in service committee in the lead of the center responsible for the formation of the MGIAN MAGISTRATES. The information about the renovation of Kou Peng Kuan was published yesterday in the official bulletin, in a order signed by SAFP subdirect, Joana Noronha, and explains that the retirement was voluntary. According to the official government portal, the CFJJ leadership was thus assumed by Tina Cheng Wai Yan, a subdirector, as a substitute director. This is the second time that Tina Cheng will have the position of director, as a substitute, repeating the situation of 2023, when the departure of the then director Manuel Trigo do CFJJ. Wai Yan performs the duties of subdirecting at CFJJ at least since 2013. Kou Peng Kuan reaches the end of his career as a civil servant who began in 1991. Throughout a professional course over 30 years old, he took different positions as a superior technician of the Public Administration Training Center, Deputy Training Division, Head of the Training Division and Head of the Administrative Modernization Department of Administration and Public Function. The high moment of the career arrived EME 2015, when it was promoted to SAFP's director, when the Government of MSAR was led by Chui Sai On. While SAFP director, Kou Peng Kuan was responsible for creating the Macao Single Account application in 2019.

item.title: Public function | Song Pek Kei wants voluntary reform program
item.description:
Given the “workloads and increasing pressures” in public administration, the deputy defends the creation of a pilot program that allows early retirement with greater financial security, in the case of health problems
Representative Song Pek Kei intends that the government implements a new experimental voluntary reform program for civil servants with health problems. The subject was approached through a written interpeação, released at the end of August to the Legislative Assembly. According to the legislator linked to the Fujian community, due to “social development” civil service officials face “workloads and increasing pressures”. Therefore, it considers that there should be an early voluntary retirement option linked to health problems, especially for workers with lower wages and the lower positions of the hierarchy, which at the same time ensures “flexibility and financial security”. "Even though some civil servants want to retire earlier for health reasons, leaving their positions means losing the security of livelihood," argues the deputy. In the understanding of Song Pek Kei, the lack of an early retirement option for health reasons that guarantees financial safety “impairs the flexibility of the pension fund system and negatively affects healthy turnover within public service”. "In response to the rapid pace of administrative reform, authorities will implement a" voluntary reform regime for civil servants "in the departments where this is necessary to promote healthy mobility within the civil service and increase the vitality of the civil service labor force," he asked. Low reforms Song Pek Kei also points out that the salaries of various civil servants are low and that they do not allow a reform consistent with a decent level of living. "Because civil servants with fewer length of service have low wages and their monthly contributions are limited, payments they can get from the Social Security Fund are very small, making it difficult to obtain practical protection for their life in reform," he said. The legislature thus calls for extra protection for these people: "Although authorities have introduced several financial assistance programs for first -rate civil servants with low income, additional improvements in their reform protection are still needed," he justifies. "In this regard, management will reinforce the current reform protection system, for example, granting subsistence subsidies in reform to renovated junior civil servants," he asks.

item.title: 60,000 people watched in Macao at the Beijing Military Parade
item.description: A total of 60,000 people watched yesterday in the broad broadcast of the “commemorative ceremony of the 80th anniversary of the victory of the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and the anti -fascist World War”, which took place at the Macao Polytechnic University and the Sports Complex at Macao, as well as other places. According to an official statement, the 60,000 people include students and civil servants. Several "higher education and non -higher institutions have organized sessions for students to assist in direct transmission in educational institutions." In addition, "several government departments have also organized sessions for civil servants to attend such activity." The ceremony in question included the military parade that took place in Beijing, in Tiananmen Square, and gathered several heads of state. Thus, it is understood that the 60,000 participants from Macau “joined the homeland and the people to remember history, pay tribute to martyrs, value peace and create a great future”. Remember the struggles André Cheong, secretary for administration and justice, recalled that "80 years ago the Chinese people achieved significant victories in the war against Japanese aggression after the persistence and resilience of 14 years of bloody struggles", and the "victories were a historical turning point, in which the Chinese nation went from humiliation to rebirth." According to the Chinese channel of Rádio Macau, Kong Chi Meng, director of the Directorate of Education and Youth Development Services (DSEDJ), the direct transmission of the military parade in Beijing constituted a kind of “first class of the new school year and a living practice of patriotic education”. In turn, the game dealers also joined this event. This was the case of MGM China, which in the MGM Macau and MGM Cotai developments organized the broadcast of the parade “in the team's member dining rooms and the backstage” of employees, giving teams “the opportunity to witness this memorable moment together and share pride for the prosperity and strength of the nation”, says the operator in a statement. A stopping zone of the stop on MGM Cotai Grande Salon was also added. War II | Sam Hou Fai highlights “Macao compatriots” The chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, highlighted yesterday, regarding the ceremony of commemoration of the 80th anniversary of the victory of the Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and anti -fascist World War, that "all Macau compatriots will remember the story, pay tribute to martyrs and value the stability that was not easy to achieve." The event, which took place at Tiananmen Square and featured the organization of a military stop that brought together heads of state from around the world, also had the presence of the head of the Executive of the MSAR. He also recalled, quoted by an official statement, that "during the 14 years of resistance against Japanese aggression, the Communist Party of China defended and always persisted in a united national front against Japanese aggression, playing a fundamental role."

item.title: Public function | CE says to vote shows fidelity to the Mand
item.description:
The civil service workers received a letter from the Chief Executive to appeal to the vote in the legislatures, indicating that vote is a demonstration of faithfulness to the MSAR. Sam Hou Fai mentioned the revision of the Management Statute that establishes the dismissal as a penalty for employees who are not faithful to
The government is betting on reversing record abstention in the last legislative elections, repeating on several occasions the importance of suffrage to the Legislative Assembly (AL) of 14 September to the Macao Political Agenda. Moreover, in various circumstances it was underlined by rulers and the chairman of the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) that this is the first election after the revision of the electoral law, and reinforces the principle "Macao governed by patriots". This was one of the points mentioned in the letter sent by the Chief Executive to all civil servants at MSAR. But in addition to the appeal to the vote, the Chief Executive states that “according to the Macao Public Administration Workers Statute (ETAPM), recently reviewed workers and public entities of all levels must defend the Basic Law and be faithful to the Fasome of the Popular Republic of China (RPC)”. item.title: Cape Verde - Si Ka Ten Txuba, Morê Di Sedi, Si Txuba Ben, Morrê Fogade
item.description: It is no longer news, but it remains very alive in the memory of the Cape Verdeans the tragedy that plagued the islands of St. Vincent and Santo Antão, a few weeks ago. And everything that happened is related not only to our old acquaintance of the Azores, but also to the topography of Africa in the latitude of the Cape Verdean islands and the simultaneity of certain meteorological and oceanographic circumstances. In order to begin the formation of a tropical depression, which may or may not evolve in the sense of its intensification, giving rise to tropical storm and, later, the hurricane1, it is necessary that the ocean surface temperature is relatively high (statistically equal to or greater than 27ºC), that there is a small disturbance in the field of atmospheric pressure (a voucher designated by “wave of the east”) Vertical of this disturbance varies little with altitude (shear, or Wind Shear, weak). The simultaneity of these circumstances occurred in the early hours of August 11, 2025, which caused the death of nine people and transformed many homes and infrastructure into wreckage, on the island of São Vicente. In addition to the natural factors mentioned, they also contributed to this calamity the weak memory that characterizes human beings, regarding meteorological phenomena, and the fact that the National Institute of Meteorology and Geophysics (INMG - Cape Verde Meteorological Authority) has no strategically placed meteorological radars to proceed to a more efficient surveillance of systems evolution meteorological. If the authorities remembered that such situations have already occurred, although sporadically, they would probably not allow the construction of houses on the beds and banks of the almost permanently dry streams. But nature does not forgive and, whenever it rains intensely, the water drips to the lower areas, resuming paths already traveled, that is, the beds of these streams. During the dawn of this day, after many of the inhabitants of Mindelo became fun at the characteristic parties of August, a tropical depression caused heavy rain, especially in the islands of São Vicente and Santo Antão. The amount of hasty water reached 192.3 mm in just 5 hours, higher than the average annual precipitation, which corresponds to about 38 5 liters of water to fall on the surface of 1 m² during this period, practically throughout the island of São Vicente. It rains little in Cape Verde, but when it rains, it sometimes happens with great intensity, usually by the action of weather disturbances designated by east waves or tropical depressions that derive from them, and can evolve into tropical storms and hurricanes. Some of these meteorological systems that occur in the North Atlantic begins in the vicinity of Cape Verde, a country consisting of an archipelago located in the North Atlantic Ocean, approximately between the 15th and 17th N and the Meridians 22nd and 26th West, formed by two subgroups: Satellian Islands (Santo Antão, St. Vincent, Santa Luzia, Saint North and Boavista) of parallel 16 N and islands of empowerment (May, Santiago, Fogo and Brava), south of the same parallel. The archipelago suffers almost permanently, especially the islands of Well, Northeast winds, the so -called high winds, relatively dry due to the part of the route to occur over the Sahel. These winds, which blow in the southeast edge of the Azores anticyclone, sometimes carry sand and dust of the Sáara that arrive in Cape Verde and beyond, crossing a large length of the Atlantic. In turn, the southeast winds that, due to the rotation of the Earth inflate to the southwest after crossing the Ecuador (Coriolis effect), associated with the almost permanent anticyclone of Santa Helena, located in the South Atlantic, more humid converges with the northeast executions, giving rise to an area designated by Intertropical Convergence Zone (Intertropical Convergence Zone - Zone - Zone - Zone - Zone - Zone - Zone - Itcz). In this area, due to the convergence of the two types of heights, the air is required to rise giving rise to the condensation of water vapor and the formation of clouds often vertical development, designated by cumulonimbus, characterized by strong precipitation and thunderstorms. This zone of convergence moves throughout the year, following the apparent movement of the sun, with some delay, reaching the northern latitude in August/September, regressing south as the year advances, reaching the lower latitude in December/January. The weather conditions in Cape Verde are mainly determined by ITCZ's position in relation to the archipelago. Thus, the rainy season (August, September and October) occurs when ITCZ ​​is north, and the dry season covers the months from April to June, being July the month of transition. You can also consider the months from November to March as an intermediate station. During the rainy season, sometimes east waves are formed in the southern regions of ITCZ, due in part to the action of the mountains in Africa, which introduce disturbances in the air flow, progressing from east to west between the latitudes 5 and 20 N, covering the region where Cape Verde is located. One of these waves of east was formed on August 9 and evolved into tropical depression. When the sustained maximum winds reached 34 knots (63 km/h) depression went to the category of tropical storm with the name Erin2 on August 11, having evolved to hurricane on the 15th. Later, on August 16, reached category 5, the strongest of the Saffir-Simpson3 hurricane scale. When it caused the greatest damage in Cape Verde, the weather system was not yet attributed, which only happened when tropical depression evolved into tropical storm. Its route followed approximately the designated path, in the meteorological media, by “Cape Verde route”, which consists of a route around the Azores anticyclone, near Cape Verde, progressing west, northwest, northern, recurring to the northeast, and may reach Europe as an extratropical depression. The well-known singer Bana (pseudonym of Adriano Gonçalves), the “king of warm”, in the song “Sina de Cape Verde”, expressed well the hardness of the climate of his country: “Si Ka Ten Txuba, Morê Di Sedi, Si Txuba Ben, Morrê Fogade” (if there is no rain dies of thirst, if the rain comes drowned). Also Manuel Lopes4, long before Bana, portrayed in his soap opera “The Flagellates of the East Wind”, the tragedy, although, in the opposite signal, of the Cape Verdean people for long periods of drought. Olavo Rasquinho (Meteorologist) References Tropical cyclones, before reaching the hurricane classification, passes through several phases, depending on wind velocity: tropical depression, tropical storm and hurricane (typhoon in northwestern Pacific and China Sea). When the maximum sustained winds are equal to or greater than 34 nodes (63 km/h) tropical depression passes the tropical storm (Tropical Storm). When equal to or greater than 64 knots (119 km/h), it takes the name of hurricane, typhoon, or cyclone, according to the regions. In the case of Northwest Pacific and Southern Sea of ​​China, there is still an intermediate category, between the tropical storm and the typhoon, which is the severe tropical storm, when the maximum sustained winds reach equal or higher values ​​48 nodes (88 km/h) and less than 64 knots. The depression system only begins to be designated by an international name when reaching the tropical storm category. In the case of Northwest of the Pacific and Southern Sea of ​​China, the names are attributed by Escap/WMO Typhoon Committee, whose secretariat has been based in Macao since 2007. In the Atlantic, the names are attributed by the Hurricane Committee, whose secretariat is based in Miami. On the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale, these meteorological systems are classified based on the speed of the maximum winds sustained within 1 minute: Category 1 - 64 to 82 nodes (119–153 km/h) Category 2 - 83 to 95 knots (154–177 km/h) Category 3 - 96 to 113 knots (178–208 km/h) Category 4 - 114 to 135 knots (209–251 km/h) Category 5 -> 135 knots (> 250 km/h) Manuel dos Santos Lopes (1907-2005)-writer, poet and essayist, born in Cape Verde. Together with Baltazar Lopes da Silva, Jorge Barbosa and other Cape Verdean intellectuals, he founded in Mindelo in 1936, the magazine “Clarity”, integrated into a movement of social, cultural and political emancipation of the Cape Verdean people.

item.title: The ethical wire of science
item.description: "The Sciences Are Unaware That They Lack A Conscience." Edgar Morin The year 2025 did not arrive with fanfare, but with fatigue. The world, after a decade marked by pandemics, algorithmic governance, ecological collapses and epistemic fragmentation, is suspended between acceleration and exhaustion. In this climate, Edgar Morin's prophetic warning in his book “Science with conscience” considered as soul ruin not as an outdated aphorism but as a structural diagnosis. Its 1990s lamentation on the split between knowledge and wisdom now requires radical rereading. For in 2025 the crisis is no longer merely moral; It became ontological. The very categories by which we understand reality, truth, life and identity were destabilized by the unbridled expansion of technoscience, the commodification of cognition and the erosion of shared meaning. Morin's original thesis, rooted in the post-World War I and the rise of nuclear science, warned against the triumph of instrumental rationality dissociated from ethical reflection. He saw in the figure of Faust not only a literary archetype, but a civilizational trajectory in the pursuit of power through knowledge, disagreeed with responsibility. Today, this Faustian impulse has metastized. Artificial intelligence (AI), synthetic biology, neurocapitalism and planetary engineering are no longer speculative domains and are operational realities. However, the awareness that should accompany such power remains conspicuously absent, or worse, outsourced to market logic and predictive algorithms. Adapting Morin's work to the reality of 2025 demands, first of all, to confront the epistemological rupture that defines our era. Science, once a search for truth, has become a battlefield of competing narratives. Climate models are politicized, instrumentalized epidemiological data, and even the concept of evidence is subjected to tribal fidelities. The Enlightenment promise of universal reason fragmented itself into eco cameras and epistemic silos. Morin's appeal to “complex thinking” capable of integrating uncertainty, contradiction and interdependence is more urgent than ever. But complexity today is not just an intellectual virtue. It is a survival strategy. Consider the domain of AI. In 2025, AI systems govern not only logistics and finance, but also judicial judgments, access to education and even emotional companionship. These systems, trained in vast data sets, reflect and amplify the prejudices of their creators and the societies from which they learn. However, your authority is rarely questioned. The opacity of automatic learning models, combined with fetishization of efficiency, has created a new technocratic priesthood whose decisions are shielded against democratic scrutiny. Morin's criticism of reductionism and the tendency to isolate variables and ignore the context here is its most unsettling expression. The algorithm does not ask why; Optimizes. And in doing so, erodes the very conditions of ethical deliberation. Biotechnology offers another border where science without conscience threatens to break the human condition. The genetic edition, once confined to laboratories, is now marketed as improvement. The line between therapy and the increase is blurred, and with it, the concept of normality. Morin's insistence on inseparability between biology and culture becomes a vital corrective. For what is at stake is not just the manipulation of genomes, but the redefinition of what is human being. The temptation to engineering intelligence, emotion and even morality risks reducing a person to a programmable function. In this context, consciousness cannot be a post-criticism but must be the architect. The ecological dimension of Morin's thought equally requires renewal. In 2025, the anthropocene is no longer a theoretical builder to becoming a lived reality. Climatic refugees, collapse of biodiversity and erratic weather standards witness the planetary consequences of scientific arrogance. However, the dominant response remains technocratic because geoengineering schemes, carbon markets and resilience panels. Morin's ecological humanism and his vision of the earth as a living system in which humans are simultaneously participants and guardians offers a counter-notarial. Appeals to a science that listens, coexiste and healing. Not a science of domination, but of communion. Perhaps more urgently, Morin's work must be reinterpreted in the light of cultural fragmentation. In 2025, identity became simultaneously refuge and weapon. The global village promised by digital connectivity degenerated in tribal enclaves, each with its epistemology, morality and aesthetics. Science, once bridge between cultures, risks becoming a tool for exclusion. The language of alienic specialization, the pairs review rituals they intimidate, and the impact indicators distort. Morin's appeal to transdisciplinarity and dialogue between science, art, philosophy and experienced experience is not a luxury but a necessity. Only intertwining multiple ways of knowing we can restore the tissue of the shared meaning. This "science without conscience" reimagined must therefore be more than a criticism, must be a manifest. It should appeal to a pedagogy of complexity, a policy of humility and an ethics of care. It must challenge scientific institutions to democratize their processes, to confront their blind points, and embrace uncertainty not as a threat but as a condition of truth. It should invite scientists to become citizens, and citizens to complain about science as a public good. In this spirit, the university must be reconstituted. It is no longer a silo of specialization, it must become a sanctuary of integration. Curricula must be redesigned to cultivate not only technical competence but moral imagination. Students should be trained to ask not only "like" but "why" and "for whom." Research should be evaluated not only by its novelty, but for its relevance, inclusiveness and ability to illuminate the human condition. Morin's vision of education as a process of awakening and learning to live, understand and coexist must guide this transformation. Likewise, scientific publication should evolve. The fetishization of impact factors and quotation counts created a culture of performative productivity. Knowledge is fragmented in hyper specialized articles, inaccessible to the public and often irrelevant to pressing concerns. An editorial ecosystem should prioritize accessibility, interdisciplinarity and public involvement. It must reward synthesis, reflection and the courage to ask foundational questions. The media, too, should recover their role as mediators of consciousness. In 2025, scientific communication is often reduced to sensational titles and polarized debates. The nuance, context and humility that Morin defended are victims of the economy of attention. Journalists should be formed not only in scientific literacy, but in ethical discernment. They must resist the temptation to simplify and instead cultivate the art of complexity. They must tell stories that enlighten the dilemmas, risks and humanity behind the data. At the geopolitical level, Morin's insights offer a picture to rethink global governance. The pandemic revealed the fragility of international cooperation and the dangers of scientific nationalism. In 2025, vaccination diplomacy, climate negotiations and digital sovereignty continue to be contesting arenas. A science infused of conscience must advocate for planetary solidarity. It must recognize that viruses, carbon molecules and algorithms do not respect borders. It should appeal to agile, inclusive and responsible institutions not only before states, but before future peoples, ecosystems and generations. This vision requires courage. For the forces that oppose consciousness are formidable because they aim to profit reasons, institutional inertia and ideological rigidity. But the alternative is unsustainable. A science without conscience leads not only to moral decay, but to civilizational collapse. It generates alienation, injustice and ecological ruin. Reduces the human spirit to a variable in a model, a knot in a net, to a consumer of innovation. To resist this trajectory, we must cultivate what Morin called "Reliance" which is the ability to connect, care and create. We must rediscover the joy of the question, the humility of not knowing and the responsibility of knowing. We must build institutions that honor complexity.

item.title: Robotic rental belly (II)
item.description: Last week, we talked about the research that allows a robot to play the role of rental belly and become the first "mother robot". If successful, the mother robot may have babies. The mother robot costs 100,000 rmb. If a child is born through this method, someone will have to pay the "delivery" expenses. Who is this "someone" and how much the "childbirth expenses" ascend? At the outset, it will be naturally the parents who will pay. The use of this method is mainly determined by mother's health problems, which prevent her from bringing a pregnancy to good port, so she resorts to the help of the mother robot. In this case there is no controversy. However, if the embryo that grows in the “belly” of the mother robot has not been generated by the couple's genetic material, or if it only results from an egg or sperm of a single person or one of the elements of a homosexual couple, then it will be necessary to resort to the help of third parties and the situation becomes more complicated. In either case the legislation is essential and will have to regulate the following: 1. Is it cool to use the mother robot as a rental belly? 2. If it is cool, can the robot mother give birth? 3. How should a mother robot company work? The mother robot is a new health product that helps solve the problem of female infertility, but also raises another question: Can a woman accept that a robot gives birth to her child? Many labor legislations regulate maternity leave and some already include paternity leave. International treaties also clearly regulate women's work rights. However, in reality, and in some companies, only women who are not prepared to have children occupy the highest positions. This conduct has long been harming women. With the help of the mother robot this problem could disappear and the competition between men and women in the workplace would be more equal. Reality also shows that mothers are more loving and have narrower relationships with their children. These factors are inseparable from pregnancy. Women carry their children for nine months in their befels. The children are the light of their eyes. Taking care of children is a natural right. Women who have given birth can more intensely experience the greatness of life and will undoubtedly have more charitable hearts. Will the mother robot eliminate these virtues? Children conceived from the sperm and egg of biological parents are believed to be the less controversial. Under these circumstances, the law only needs to regulate the technique of design of the mother robot. However, when it comes to generating a child from a single father or mother or a homosexual couple, we are facing an ethical issue that cannot be easily addressed. Admittedly, the mother robot can only conceive if there is anyone who delivers the babies, otherwise it would be generating orphans, creating another social problem. The third question that the law should consider is the operability of the companies responsible for the mother robots. Mother robots are simultaneously health products and commercial products. The legal regulation of commercial products is first aimed at the benefit of humanity. Therefore, the storage and use of sperm, eggs and medical records should be the subject of professional and specialized counseling. The law should not regulate the profits of Mother Robot companies, because the essence of the business is profit. The most important thing about business is to evaluate the market and stay on the wave crest to earn the first “gold pot”. When the technology of the mother robot matures and the legal framework is in force, other commercial considerations will arise. Therefore, if it is cool the mother robot to give birth, the initial costs are expected to be very high. If a product is inaccessible to normal people and can only be purchased by very rich, is it really a health product? During the 2019 pandemic, the United Nations provided free vaccines to countries with financial difficulties. Later, the United States waived the patents of its vaccine, allowing other countries to produce and use it. In both cases scientific progress has been shared in the area of ​​medicine and avoided the creation of profit at the expense of the weaker. With current technological advances, the development of artificial uteros is imminent and the creation of the mother robot is not a surprise. However, implications for resources, ethics and legislation deserve more careful attention. item.title: Music | Noyb presents “Improvised Live Sessions” in the mud
item.description: It is already tomorrow, September 6, that the event “None of Your Business (Noyb) Improvised Live Sessions”, which brings to Macau a series of artists and DJs in which the music played of improvisation and experimental way promises to be the watchword. The party takes place between 17h and 11pm and brings to the Van Nam factory, on Olympic Avenue, on the mud, “a avant -garde world of makeshift musical action, video installations and an innovative modular synthesizer workshop,” says Noyb on social networks. Thus, “visionary artists from Macao, Portugal, Spain, Japan and other places are joined in the mud, creating a unique tapestry of sounds and visual art”, and there will be no shortage of gastronomy spaces and the “company of other art enthusiasts” to make music and enjoy it. The poster is made with Logoss, which acts the day before in Beishan, Zhuhai; DJ Sniff, Larsq, Ezara Thustra and DJs Tongrim and Fon. Experimental maneuvers Regarding the artistic path of the participants at this Experimentation Party, Fon was born in Canton, Guangzhou, but was created in Macao. However, he also lived in New York and Los Angels, where he worked as a musician and conceptual artist. “Its diverse formation inspires the exploitation of sound, visual arts, performance and improvisation,” says Noyb. Fon's musical taste is also "strongly influenced by New York Vanguardists, such as H0L0 and Bossa Nova Civic Club, as well as the" Underground "scene of parties in Macao and the song Trap Cantonense." Also noteworthy is the sound project “Larsq”, by Rui Rasquinho, designer and illustrator of Lisbon that has long made Macau to his home. With "Larsq" the public can enjoy "pedals of effects, noise synthesizers and a guitar under the influence of improvisation, situated somewhere between the abstract and narrative." In the case of DJ Sniff, it is a musician, curator and educator whose work “is done with different practices that combine 'djing, instrument design and free improvisation”. DJ Sniff has worked in Amsterdam and was a visiting assistant professor at the University of Hong Kong University between 2012 and 2017. He has collaborated with names like Evan Parker, Otomo Yoshihide, Paul Hubweber, Tarek Atoui, Senyawa and Ken Ueno. From Spain, more concretely Tenerife, the Lagoss project comes, and its presentation is immediately warned: listening to these sounds can "cause involuntary wandarings by islands that do not exist." Logoss is therefore an "audiovisual project whose sound goes beyond the spectrum of what our ears are used to," inspired by "exotic mythologies and spiritual sounds." Thus, “immersive sound landscapes that challenge any simple categorization” are created, with a song that is “a singular fusion of synthesizer cosmic explorations, unstable dub rhythms and imagined islands field recordings, all sustained by a healthy dose of psycho-psycho, improvisation and 'live looping' of electronic and acoustic instruments”. In this way, the audience can see, listen and feel tomorrow "a particular sound and organic universe, which the band itself describes as the island folklore of the future or cyber-tropicalism."

item.title: Chinese Orchestra | Peng Xiuwen and Liu Tianyi honored in a new season
item.description:

Macao is expected to become an “city of East Asian culture” and, therefore, the new concert programming of the Macau Chinese Orchestra (OCM) 2025/2026 is there with many shows of tribute to masters of Chinese classical music and to celebrate special dates for Macao and China. After the opening concert of the season that took place on August 30, November 29 hosts the show of tribute to Liu Tianyi, considered a great master of traditional Chinese music, above all Cantonense, and focused on the traditional instrument Gaohu. “In celebration of the 115th birthday of Liu Tianyi - Cantonese Harmonic” is the name of the show that shows “The Bright Case Career of the Maestro and the remarkable contribution to this musical genre”. The event is scheduled for The Venetian Theater from 20h, and tickets are already on sale. “Cisne” is a work created by Guangzhou's award -winning theater of arts, narrating “The Exciting Path of Growth and Formation of Acrobatic Artist Yu Meng, from the sore training fields to the center of the stunning stage”. According to a note from the Cultural Institute (IC), the public will open between the “dream” and the “real”, experiencing “the impressive fusion between national artistic excellence and a fantastic visual show”. The show that performs at The Venetian Theater "was selected for the Financial Support Program by the National Arts Fund and honored with the" Product Prize of Excellence ", being directed by choreographer Zhao Ming. The artistic direction is in charge of Wu Zhengdan, actress and founder of the “Shoulder Ballet”. Smells of “Swan Lake” "Swan" is a play that "brings together prestigious artists, using the timeless melodies of the Western classic Ballet" The Lake of Swan ", at the same time integrates the great and unpublished Chinese acrobat, offering the public a scenic show that shows the fusion between oriental and western art." The “Show of Commemoration of the 76th Anniversary of the Implementation of the Popular Republic of China and the Haojiang Moonlight Night - New Acrobatic Short Show” is organized by the China Ministry of Culture and Tourism and the Secretariat for Social Affairs and Culture of the Government of the MSAR, without forgetting the organization of the IC and Department of Advertising of the Central Popular Government, among other entities. Tickets have prices ranging from 200 to 400 patacas.

item.title: Coloane | Music, exercises and workshops at the end of the month
item.description:
The third edition of “Connections - Music.Movement.Nature”, returns to Coloane on September 27 and 28 to the “Urban Farm” space. This is where activities happen for all tastes, but always in connection with nature, music, the arts and even the body itself, thanks to the practice of Pilates and Yoga
Image by Elói Scarva Last weekend of September, the Urban Farm space, in the center of Coloane village, will host the event “Connections - Music.Movement.Nature”. This is a two-day event, taking place on September 27th and 28th, which brings together artistic activities, music and exercise, with yoga and pilates. This is a “non -profit private initiative that aims to bring together different communities, offering music, family activities, body and holistic workshops, a food and beverage zone and a handicraft market with local breeders,” says a statement from the organization. Those who are behind this event assume that “Connections” is a “collective creation that combines a conscious way of life with unique experiences”, and has been around since 2018 and 2019, years when the event took place with the Ka-Hó dam, also in Coloane. However, the “connections” now moves to a larger space, which will allow several activities to be taken throughout seven distinct zones. They are the “Village”, described as “a picturesque area that resembles a traditional Chinese village, with wooden houses in an oriental garden”, which will be the meal and beverage and craft sales zone. Here will be represented spaces for restoration of Macao, such as Larry’s Place, Concept H, Black Lotus, Cakes by Rose & Muse, Juk and Happy Stand. There will also be 12 artisans to sell their products in the various wooden houses of “Village”: Dreama, Neska, Zarja's Selections, Ceragigi, Ododoodo, Dollfie, Wickd, White Lodge Dreamland, Wutoyeah, Lylon Skincare and Knotme. "Urban Farm" will also feature "Gypsy Camp", a "zone with pillows and rest places in the shadow that promises to be an interactive offer, where participants will be able to explore musical instruments such as Asalato, participate in a circle of drums, or watch a Handpan concert with duo Nàv, which curates the area." “It will also be here that one can attend the ritual of the fire, a lecture on spiritual themes and participate in individual sessions of tarot and soul reading,” explains the organization. Families activities will take place at Family Tent, offering families meditation sessions, mandala drawings, crochet, building masks in cardboard and even interactive reading moments. The organization intends, with the connections, to bring “the younger ones to participate in any activity that is taking place in the room, provided that it is accompanied by parents, and can also explore the offer of‘ Urban Farm ’, which provides fishing canas to fish and agriculture activities”. Meditation tree A zone that deserves prominence is the “Treetop”, a “mezzannine” built in the cup of a tree, and which was the space chosen for all body exploration activities and “more serene moments”, meditation and relaxation. With activities taking place in the morning to dusk, the “Treetop” will host dance sessions, with zumba, backed, conscious dance and insideflow, as well as yoga, gyrokinessis [Movement that mixes principles of yoga, dance and tai chi], and pilates. Sessing Sings of Sound Bath, exploration of mantras and meditations to sunset and connection with nature are also foreseen. O “Urban Farm” também disponibiliza uma “yurte mongol” [tenda típica dos povos nómadas da Mongólia], decorrendo ainda uma sessão das “Noites de Quiz”, que já acontece regularmente em Macau. "This is the first time that Quiz's night will be oriented in English so that more people can participate in the session," explained the organizers. At the bottom of the Urban Farm property, in the “Concrete” zone, graffiti and urban art sessions are scheduled with the collectives of local artists Outloud International Street Art Festival and Mid Age of Dawn Skateboards (M.A.O.D.). Finally, in the Woods, in a clearing of a small woods, is the space of electronic music and outdoor dance, which will feature installments from various local DJs and the region. The musical offer will also be present in the “Village” area, with a more organic selection, Lounge, and focused on songs in the world. Tickets for “Connections” are already on advance sales until tomorrow, with prices ranging from 150 to 250 Patacas, for one or two days of the event. The “Urban Farm” also provides parking spaces that can be reserved daily in advance.

item.title: SMG | Low pressure can pass the tropical cyclone
item.description: Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) indicated that between today and tomorrow “a low pressure area develops in the central part of the Southern Sea of ​​China, moving to the west coast of Guangdong between the weekend and the beginning of next week”. The projections point to an approach to the Guangdong coast "at a relatively fast pace", but with a "very slow" intensification. As such, SMG referred yesterday that "it is not yet possible to determine if it will become a tropical cyclone." Regardless of whether the system becomes a tropical cyclone or not, any of the forecast models "predict, generally, that rain along the Guangdong coast will increase from the weekend, and will be accompanied by increasingly strong wind." SMG estimates that this morning in Macao is very hot, with the maximum temperature being able to exceed 33 degrees, "due to the continuous influence of an anticyclone at high altitude."

item.title: Sneakers | Hijacked woman in cotai
item.description: Two inland men were arrested after kidnapping a woman in a hotel room. The case was released yesterday by the Judicial Police (PJ), and the sequestration resulting from a loaning case. The woman requested a loan from two men worth $ 200,000 from Hong Kong to play in the casino. However, in the space of hours lost all the money. The loan sharks still asked him for an extra $ 100,000 interest payment for the money borrowed. With no means to pay, the woman was taken to a hotel room and prevented from leaving. However, taking advantage of a distraction, he managed to call her husband to ask her to call the police. Alerted, the PJ moved to the hotel, released the woman and stopped the two men. These refused to cooperate with the investigation. The PJ believes that there is at least another man involved in the case, who has not yet been arrested but is being sought.

item.title: Real Estate | Centaline predicts continuous climb of rent
item.description:
The Centaline Real Estate Agency estimates that the average price of real estate revenues will continue to increase by the end of the year, a trend that began two years ago. Experts explain the rise of the lease market with the breach of real estate sales and the return of non-residents after the pandemic
Who does not buy, lease. It is in this polarity that based on the dynamics of the real estate market, according to the Centaline real estate agency, which provides that average housing rents continue to rise in the third and fourth quarters, exceeding 140 patacas per square meter in housing autonomous fractions. Macao and Hengqin Centaline Real Estate Director Roy Ho provides that average lace per square meter can try to pass the 145 patacas in the middle of next year. It is recalled that, according to data from the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services, the average incomes of housing fractions have fallen in the pandemic years. In the first quarter of 2020, the average square meter income cost 160 patacas, when the descent began, culminating in the 129.8 patacas per square meter in the second trimester of 2023, reflecting a break of almost one fifth (19 percent). However, the situation was reversed from the third quarter of 2023, until it reached 138.7 patacas per square meter in the second quarter of this year, showing a rise of 6.86 percent. Why why Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, Roy Ho began to explain the phenomenon with the end of border restrictions in 2023, the resuming the economy that required more labor and the increase in the number of non-resident workers (TNR). In addition, with the breakdown of sales, residents who planned to buy housing suspended the plans due to economic difficulties and the devaluation of real estate, leaving them the lease market. Also the number of Chinese students who choose Macau to continue their studies in higher education has increased in recent years, adds the centaline official. Roy Ho also pointed out that the apartments from T0 to T2 are scarce for the search for students from the interior of China and TNR, whose incomes range from 8,000 to 20,000 patacas per month. The apartments in buildings in Taipa and Coloane, closer to universities, record great demand from students. By the way, the smallest apartments in the mud had last year lace around 9,500 patacas, which increased by about 1,000 patacas over 2025. The real estate agency director also indicated that also in hengqin lace prices increased.

item.title: Health | Registered cases of chikungunya and dengue
item.description: Health services announced yesterday the occurrence of another imported case of chikungunya fever, the 12th since the beginning of the year, to which a local case is added. In addition, there was also a case of a case imported from dengue fever. The 12th imported case of chikungunya fever was detected in a 77 -year -old resident, which was infected in Jiangmen, where it was August 24 and 31. "After returning to Macao, he had fever and member joint pain on September 2, but did not seek medical attention. On the 3rd, due to the continuous aggravation of symptoms, he moved to the Interior Port Health Center to receive health care and the blood test gave the Chikungunya virus," he was revealed. The woman is out of danger and in a stable situation. The imported case of dengue was the 13th of the year and was identified in a 73 -year -old man living in the black sand. The infection will have happened in the city of Yunfu, in Guangdong province, between July 7 and August 28, with the man admitting that he was "stung several times by mosquitoes." The diagnosis was made after September 3. As a consequence of the latest cases, the authorities performed chemical elimination operations of mosquitoes in two black sand zones, next to the residence of the diagnosed people.

item.title: Fencing | Association confirms prohibition of using flag
item.description: Macau's General Fencing Association confirmed from preventing local athletes from using the Macao flag in competitions, in a response sent to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. The case was reported earlier this week after several local athletes competed at the Cadet Asia Cup in Malaysia, having reached wins and several medals. However, unlike the athletes of Hong Kong and Kazakhstan who climbed the podiums with the flags to take photographs, the athletes of Macao, despite winning, were prevented. According to the explanations of the Macao General Fencing Association, the athletes are prevented from showing the Macao flag because the trip was not made in representation of the Macao team. The Association did not clarify whether athletes who want to show pride of being from Macao and China when showing the flag of mashes will be the subject of disciplinary proceedings or prevented from competing. Still, the Association defended itself by saying that it helped the athletes enroll in the event, although the athletes pay the registration and travel due to individual participation. The association is also being criticized due to the organization of the inter-school tournament, as it has gathered in a single class athletes that compete with weapons of different sizes due to the difference in ages. The association justified the decision, criticized for creating inequality between athletes, with the adoption of criteria followed in other modalities other than fencing.

item.title: Shun Tak | 8% of Macao Tower workers
item.description:
The company led by Pansy Ho has ongoing a plan to cut costs that can be extended in the future to Shopping Centers Nova Mall and New Yaohan. In 2024, the group presented losses of $ 824 million from Hong Kong
The Macao Tower is being the subject of a process of restructuring expenses and at least eight percent of workers have been dismissed. The information was advanced on Thursday by the Macao channel of TDM. The space belongs to the Macao Tourism and Tourism Society (STDM) and is being managed by the company Shun Tak Holdings, linked to Pansy Ho, Daisy Ho and Maisy Ho, businesswoman and daughters of Stanley Ho, founder of STDM. In order to cut the operating costs of the space, the company dismissed at least eight percent of workers and ended two stores. The commercial spaces that stopped operating are Café On Four, on the fourth floor, and the ISA store, in clothes and luxury accessories. Among the exempted workers include employees of the closed spaces, but also employees of the Macao Tower. According to TDM, plans to control costs in the spaces managed by Shun Tak Holdings may not be by the Macao Tower and extended to other shopping center. In addition to the Macao Tower, Shun Tak Holding explores the Shopping Centers Nova Mall and New Yaohan. Planned plan To TDM, Rutger Verschuren, regional vice president of Artyzen Macau, also controlled by Shun Tak, confirmed not only restructuring but also being leading the plan. However, he refused to make other comments on the situation. The year 2024 ended for the company led by the businesswoman and politics pansy Ho with losses of $ 824 million from Hong Kong. By 2023, the company had presented losses of $ 677 million from Hong Kong. The data are included in the 2024 annual report presented to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, which also indicates that the group employed about 1,700 people, including Outside Macao operations, in places such as Hong Kong, China or Singapore. In addition, the company has bank loans worth $ 15.4 billion from Hong Kong, with more than 90 percent of this amount to be paid within five years. SHUN TAK was created with a 1961 navigation company by Stanley Ho to make the sea connections between Macau and Hong Kong, a service that still offers today through the control of the outdoor port. With the advance of the years, he expanded the scope of activities to areas such as hotels, opening the East Mandarin Hotel in Macao, or for real estate, with construction and exploration of projects in Hong Kong and Macau, but also inside and in Singapore.

item.title: Glory Elevator | Macao without requests for support after accident
item.description:
STD confirmed that HM did not have received requests for assistance from Macao residents in Lisbon related to the accident that killed at least 16 people, many of which tourists of various nationalities
The Directorate of Tourism Services (STD) received no request for assistance or clarification of doubts related to the derailment of the glory funicular, which caused at least 16 deadly victims in Lisbon. The information was revealed by STD in clarifications to HM. "With regard to the accident in Lisbon, so far, STD has not received any request for information or assistance," DSAT said in response to HM. "In case of need, Macao residents can call the 24 -hour Tourism Open Tourism line (853) 2833 3000, or to the Direct Global Emergency Line of Protection and Consular Assistance Services of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the RPC +86 10 12308," was added. The accident happened at a time when the beginning of the school year of higher education in Portugal is approaching, so besides the representation of Macao tourists in Lisbon there is the possibility of residents of Macao living in the city to attend higher education institutions. The derailment of the glory funicular took place on Wednesday afternoon, around 6:05 pm (Portugal Hour), when the carriage that climbed to the St. Peter de Alcântara viewpoint lost control and designed to the sidewalk until violently packed in a building. As a result, there are at least 16 deadly victims and 23 injured, five of which are considered serious. Authorities have revealed that the deadly victims are people with foreign nationality. One of the victims is known to be Portuguese and that another is German. The nationality of the other foreign victims was not disclosed until the time of the HM edition. Half-tail The tragedy of Lisbon led to decreed a national day by the country's government, with the Portuguese Consulate in Macau and Hong Kong to lift the half-throat flags yesterday. In Lisbon, the City Council decreed three days of mourning. The accident involved one of Lisbon's brand images as a tourist destination. The Funicular of Glory went into operation on October 24, 1885. The reason for the derailment is not yet known, but according to the observer newspaper, which cites a source of the Lisbon Sapadors Firefighters Regiment, will be related to a cable that released themselves causing the loss of control of the funicular, which would have about 40 people inside. One of the witnesses on the spot indicated that at least one person who was on the street would have been hit by the uncontrolled funicular. The accident is raising questions about the quality of maintenance of the funicular that had already derailed in 2018, at the time without any injured or deadly victim.

He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate.
